page.title: 02ECOLOGY CONFLICT IN NORFOLK
page.content: East Anglia's coastal dunes and wet-lands are famous for their rich variety of flora and fauna.Certain unique habitats are found, but there has been conflict on many occasions between ecological and farming interests.East Norfolk's marshlands traditionally provide rough grazing, but also support a teeming wildlife population. Many farmers have been attracted by economic factors towards so called 'improvements'.Such improved lands produce rich arable crops, but also a serious simplification of species .Of course many farmers take an active interest in the preservation of wildlife ,but destruction of habitat of this kind must rank as a serious ecological problem in the area.
